data.name: Adam
data.description: The first human being created by Allah (God) according to Islamic belief, and the father of all humankind. Adam is considered the first prophet in Islam.

data.name: Idris
data.description: A prophet mentioned briefly in the Quran who is believed by some Muslims to have been taken alive into heaven.

data.name: Nuh
data.description: Also known as Noah, he was sent by Allah to warn his people of an impending flood and to call them to monotheism. Nuh is considered one of the most important prophets in Islam and the builder of the ark.

data.name: Hud
data.description: Sent to the people of the city of 'Ad to call them to monotheism, but they rejected his message and were subsequently destroyed by a powerful wind sent by Allah.

data.name: Saleh
data.description: Sent to the people of the city of Thamud to call them to monotheism, but they rejected his message and were subsequently destroyed by an earthquake.

data.name: Ibrahim
data.description: Also known as Abraham, he is considered the father of the prophets and the forefather of the Prophet Muhammad. Ibrahim was tested by Allah in many ways, including being commanded to sacrifice his son.

data.name: Lut
data.description: Sent to the people of Sodom and Gomorrah to call them to monotheism and to stop their immoral behavior, but they rejected his message and were subsequently destroyed by Allah with brimstone and fire.

data.name: Ismail
data.description: The son of Ibrahim and Hajar, Ismail is considered a prophet in Islam and the father of the Arab people.

data.name: Ishaq
data.description: The son of Ibrahim and Sarah, Ishaq is considered a prophet in Islam and the father of the Israelites.

data.name: Yaqub
data.description: The son of Ishaq, Yaqub is considered a prophet in Islam and the father of the twelve tribes of Israel.

data.name: Yusuf
data.description: The son of Yaqub, Yusuf is considered a prophet in Islam and was sold into slavery by his jealous brothers. He eventually became a trusted advisor to the Pharaoh of Egypt.

data.name: Shuayb
data.description: Sent to the people of the city of Midian to call them to monotheism and to stop their unjust behavior, but they rejected his message and were subsequently destroyed by Allah with a thunderbolt.

data.name: Ayyub
data.description: Ayyub, also known as Job in the Bible, is considered a prophet in Islam. He is known for his unwavering faith in Allah (God) despite experiencing severe afflictions and suffering.

data.name: Dhul-Kifl
data.description: Dhul-Kifl is a prophet mentioned in the Quran, whose identity and story is not clearly defined in Islamic tradition. Some scholars believe him to be the same as Ezekiel in the Bible.

data.name: Musa
data.description: Musa, also known as Moses in the Bible, is one of the most important prophets in Islam. He is known for leading the Israelites out of slavery in Egypt, receiving the Ten Commandments from Allah (God), and for his miracles and interactions with Pharaoh.

data.name: Harun
data.description: Harun, also known as Aaron in the Bible, is the older brother of Musa (Moses) and is considered a prophet in Islam. He is known for his role as a supporter of Musa during their mission to free the Israelites from slavery in Egypt.

data.name: Dawud
data.description: Dawud, also known as David in the Bible, is considered a prophet and a king in Islam. He is known for his bravery and his victory over the giant Goliath, as well as for his poetry and musical talents.

data.name: Sulayman
data.description: Sulayman, also known as Solomon in the Bible, is considered a prophet and a king in Islam. He is known for his wisdom, his building of the First Temple in Jerusalem, and his control over jinn and other creatures.

data.name: Ilyas
data.description: Ilyas, also known as Elijah in the Bible, is considered a prophet in Islam. He is known for his unwavering faith in Allah (God) and his many miracles, including bringing rain to a drought-stricken land.

data.name: Al-Yasa
data.description: Al-Yasa, also known as Elisha in the Bible, is considered a prophet in Islam. He is known for his miracles, including reviving a dead child and curing a leper.

data.name: Yahya
data.description: Yahya (John the Baptist) is considered a prophet and is revered in Islam for his role as a precursor to Prophet Isa (Jesus). He was known for his asceticism and preaching, calling people to repentance and righteous deeds. He is also mentioned in the Quran as one of the righteous and noble messengers of Allah.

data.name: Isa
data.description: Isa (Jesus) is considered a prophet and messenger of Allah in Islam, and is revered for his miraculous birth, his teachings, and his role as a precursor to the final prophet, Muhammad. He is also believed to have performed many miracles, including healing the sick and raising the dead. Muslims believe that Isa was not crucified, but was instead raised up by Allah, and will return to earth before the end of time.

data.name: Muhammad
data.description: Muhammad is considered the final prophet and messenger of Allah in Islam, and is revered as a religious, political, and military leader. He received revelations from Allah through the angel Gabriel, which were recorded in the Quran. Muhammad is known for his character and teachings, including the Five Pillars of Islam, which form the basis of Muslim practice. He is considered a model of righteous behavior, and his life and teachings continue to inspire Muslims around the world.
